title: Bertie's Guide to Life and Mothers
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: "Then there are Corbetts, which are between 2,500 and 3,000 feet, and Grahams, which are between 2,000 and 2,500 feet." He paused, glancing off towards the unambitious slopes of Caerketton Hill. "That hill, for instance, is only just over 1,500 feet."
